p: Thirty-two uncastrated, young Nellore ( Bos taurus indicus) bulls averaging 17 months old and 357 ± 23.4 kg in body weight who were vaccinated and treated with antiparasitics (Ivermectin, São Paulo, Brazil) were used in a completely randomized design with four treatments and eight replications. The animals were supplemented with one of the following treatments: 0 (control), 10, 30 or 50 g/kg of dry matter (DM) of condensed tannin extract ( Acacia mearnsii; Weibull AQ, TanacS, A., Montenegro, RS, Brazil) containing 720 g/kg of tannin in the extract. The extract was derived from the bark of A. mearnsii through extraction with hot water, vacuum evaporation and subsequent spray-drying.
